intro: Galium mexicanum var. flexicum, commonly known as Mexican bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its creeping growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its presence is often indicative of a healthy, undisturbed ecosystem.
